page.title: 02Cereal Farming - Henwood
page.content: Henwood farm, owned by All Souls College, consists of 328 acres, under grain, apart from a patch of woodland and a rough pasture paddock. The main crops are wheat and barley, but a new cereal,{triticale, }is being grown for the first time this year on the very dry coarse sandy soil at the top of the escarpment. Triticale is produced by crossing wheat,barley and ryegrass. It will be sold for cattle fodder. Different varieties of wheat are grown, suitable for wheat flour, pastry making or for pasta. All grain is sold to brokers when the prices are favourable, forward selling in January has already accounted for much of this season's harvest. Grain must be clean and free from weed seeds. The farmer and his wife fertilise and harvest the crops,but a contractor is employed to plough the fields.
